definition: not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
eight/8
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Although he speaks English not very well, yours is not better.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他的英語說得不好，但是你也半斤八兩。

sentences.english: Jimmy is trying to show Bill how to skate. The blind are leading the blind.
sentences.chinese: 吉米想教比爾怎麼溜冰，他們倆其實是半斤八兩。
“半斤八兩，有啥區別，”我爸爸說。

sentences.english: But here comes the counter-revolution just the same.
sentences.chinese: 而由此招致的反革命也半斤八兩。

definition: Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to be out of form/not to be oneself
to have nothing to say (idiom)
monodrama/one-man show/comic talk
masculinity/manliness
layman
harmony is to be prized
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
facial nerve paralysis
to have a grudge against
